title: Language Learning Project Design Based on Cognitive Load Theory

context.prior_knowledge: Proficiency in Basic Language Structures and Communication Skills
context.additional_context: Learners engage in language projects using the PBL (Project-Based Learning) approach, enabling collaboration through digital tools

learning_goals: Learners can apply at least three learning strategies that minimize cognitive load in language-related problem-solving projects.
Learners systematically integrate visual/auditory information to construct language schemas during project execution.
Learners explicitly explain at least two cases of cognitive load theory application in project deliverables through summative assessment.
difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
